component.name: influxdb
component.title: InfluxDB
component.description: Interact with InfluxDB v1, a time series database.
component.label: database

influxDB.description: The shared Influx DB to use for all endpoints

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camelInfluxDB.RetentionPolicy.description: The string that defines the retention policy to the data created by the endpoint

camelInfluxDB.databaseName.description: The name of the database where the time series will be stored

camelInfluxDB.query.description: Define the query in case of operation query

connectionBean.description: Connection to the influx database, of class InfluxDB.class

autoCreateDatabase.description: Define if we want to auto create the database if it's not present

batch.description: Define if this operation is a batch operation or not

checkDatabaseExistence.description: Define if we want to check the database existence while starting the endpoint

databaseName.description: The name of the database where the time series will be stored

operation.description: Define if this operation is an insert or a query

query.description: Define the query in case of operation query

retentionPolicy.description: The string that defines the retention policy to the data created by the endpoint

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.
